sect1.title: Identifying your modem
sect1.para: Most dialup modems are not supported by Ubuntu, but drivers can be found that will enable the use of some such modems. First you need to identify what chipset your dialup modem is:

step.para: Download scanmodem (&scanmodem-url;) using a computer with an Internet connection.
Copy the downloaded file to the Home folder of the computer with the dialup modem you wish to use.
Open a Terminal (&terminal;) and type the following commands, pressing Return after each line:
step.screen: gunzip -c &scanmodem-gz; > scanModem chmod +x scanModem sudo ./scanModem gedit Modem/ModemData.txt

step.para: A file containing information on the chipsets used by any detected modems should open. Print or save the information.

sect1.para: Much more detailed information is available on the community wiki.

sect1.title: Connecting with a modem
sect1.para: Network Manager provides tools which allow you to configure a modem connection.

important.para: You will need to know the following information:
ISP Phone Number; Username; Password; Domain Name Server (DNS) addresses.

step.para: Press Unlock and type your password to unlock the settings
Select Modem connection or Point to point connection and press Properties.
Ensure that Enable this connection is unchecked and enter appropriate information on each of the three tabs.
Click OK to save the information you just entered
Click Add and enter the DNS address given to you by your ISP.
